tool.name: ProjectViewshed

param.name: Input_Feature
param.dialogReference: The input feature(s) - can be point, line, or polygon.

param.name: Output_Name
param.dialogReference: The identifier that will be used to name all the outputs.

param.name: Workspace
param.dialogReference: The output location for all the outputs.

param.name: Analysis_Distance_miles
param.dialogReference: The maximum distance for viewshed analysis (in decimal miles).

param.name: N_Boundary_Points
param.displayname: Number of Project Boundary Observer Points
param.dialogReference: The number of random points to scatter along the boundary of the feature(s) - lines and polygons only.

param.name: N_Interior_Points
param.displayname: Number of Project Interior Observer Points
param.dialogReference: The number of random points to scatter within the feature(s) - polygons only.

param.name: Keep_Data
param.dialogReference: Keep the interim data (buffer, DEM clip, boundary/interior points)..

tool.summary: Compute the visible areas within a given distance from a project. Input features can be point, line, or polygon. Allows the user to choose the maximum distance for viewshed analysis (in decimal miles), the number of boundary observer points (for polygons and lines), and the number of interior observer points (for polygons). If the input features are type point, or if the user does not specify a number of boundary points (for lines), or neither boundary points nor interior points (for polygons), the tool will default to using the feature vertices (or input points) as the observer points. The user also has the option to keep the interim data (buffer, DEM clip, and boundary/interior observer points); if not selected, the tool will return only the final Observer_Points feature class, Viewshed raster and Viewshed_Polygons feature class.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Compute the visible areas within a given distance from a project. Input features can be point, line, or polygon. Allows the user to choose the maximum distance for viewshed analysis (in decimal miles), the number of boundary observer points (for polygons and lines), and the number of interior observer points (for polygons). If the input features are type point, or if the user does not specify a number of boundary points (for lines), or neither boundary points nor interior points (for polygons), the tool will default to using the feature vertices (or input points) as the observer points. The user also has the option to keep the interim data (buffer, DEM clip, and boundary/interior observer points); if not selected, the tool will return only the final Observer_Points feature class, Viewshed raster and Viewshed_Polygons feature class.
